title: How to Pack Vinyl Records for Shipping

steps.headline: Cross two pieces of bubble wrap that are as wide as the records and three and a half times as long.
steps.description: Put 20-22 records on top of the center, where the two pieces of bubble wrap cross.

steps.headline: Fold the bubble wrap over the records and secure with tape.
Cut four pieces of cardboard approximately 4" x 6" (10cm x 15 cm).
steps.description: Fold them twice and tape the ends together to make four sturdy corner protections.

steps.headline: Place the bubble-wrapped records into the record mailer and insert the four protective corners.

steps.headline: Fill in the extra space with newspaper.
Close the record mailer and secure it with a generous amount of tape.

tyn: 20 LP record mailer; try your local postal store or an office stationery store
approx. 1 x 3 feet / 30.5 centimeter (12.0 in) x 91 centimeter (35.8 in) each
text:
Cross two pieces of bubble wrap that are as wide as the records and three and a half times as long. Put 20-22 records on top of the center, where the two pieces of bubble wrap cross. Fold the bubble wrap over the records and secure with tape. Cut four pieces of cardboard approximately 4" x 6" (10cm x 15 cm). Fold them twice and tape the ends together to make four sturdy corner protections. Place the bubble-wrapped records into the record mailer and insert the four protective corners. Corner detail:{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/94\/Pack-Vinyl-Records-for-Shipping-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Pack-Vinyl-Records-for-Shipping-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/94\/Pack-Vinyl-Records-for-Shipping-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Pack-Vinyl-Records-for-Shipping-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Fill in the extra space with newspaper. Close the record mailer and secure it with a generous amount of tape.
sentences: Cross two pieces of bubble wrap that are as wide as the records and three and a half times as long.
Put 20-22 records on top of the center, where the two pieces of bubble wrap cross.
Fold the bubble wrap over the records and secure with tape.
Cut four pieces of cardboard approximately 4" x 6" (10cm x 15 cm).
Fold them twice and tape the ends together to make four sturdy corner protections.
Place the bubble-wrapped records into the record mailer and insert the four protective corners.
